intro: Zwingera ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty zwingera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and yellowish, often clustered in terminal inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
